title: The Danish Center for Strategic Research in Type 2 Diabetes
text:
This website includes details about The Danish Center for Strategic Research in Type 2 Diabetes (The DD2 Study). The intention of this website is to document the data sources used for research and to ease the day-to-day work with DD2. It is intended for employees at Department of Clinical Epidemiology (DCE), Aarhus University and Aarhus University Hospital, as it is mainly describing the setup used at DCE. Other institutions can also gain access to DD2 data but their setup might be different.
To learn more about DD2 please see: https://dd2.dk/
An extensive list of scientific publications based on data from DD2 is available on the website. That said, a good place to start is the 2018 baseline paper (Christensen et al. 2018). We are currently working on an update of this paper.




References

Christensen, D. H., S. K. Nicolaisen, K. Berencsi, H. Beck-Nielsen, J. Rungby, S. Friborg, I. Brandslund, et al. 2018. “Danish Centre for Strategic Research in Type 2 Diabetes (DD2) Project Cohort of Newly Diagnosed Patients with Type 2 Diabetes: A Cohort Profile.” Journal Article. BMJ Open 8 (4): e017273. https://doi.org/10.1136/bmjopen-2017-017273.

DD2 is based on data from multiple sources:
(vi skal have nogle gode navne til de forskellige datakilder)

DD2 core data, i.e., data that makes the foundation of DD2

DD2 questionnaire data
Biomarker data (analysis results based on the blood and urine samples from time of enrollment)

Additional DD2 data, e.g., from additional questionnaires and/or substudies. This includes data only available through DD2, but it was not collected as part of the initial enrollment process.

title: SDS
text:
Population
The DD2 data is uploaded to SDS, and they check the validity of the CPR-numbers before encrypting them. The data set DS_EXT_DD2_POP includes individuals with a valid CPR-number. Individuals with a non-valid CPR-number are still included in the uploaded data, e.g. in DS_EXT_DD2CORE, but they will have a missing encrypted CPR-number (CPR_ENCRYPTED) and can thus not be linked across data sources. Previously (when we had local data), we would notify DD2 (Odense) about non-valid CPR-numbers, but this is no longer possible as we are not allowed to identify the individuals based on individual-level data on the servers.

title: DDDA
text:
Danish Diabetes Database for Adults (DDDA) (Dansk Voksen Diabates Database, DVDD) is a no longer active database from regionernes kliniske kvalitetsudviklingsprogram (RKKP). It was closed by 30/6 2022. It has now been replaced by Dansk Diabetes Database (DDD/DDiD), which has been active since 1/7 2022.
We currently have data from DDDA in the period from May 2005 to June 2022.
DENNE SIDE SKAL BESKRIVE

DDDA - data findes kun frem til Juni 2022 DDDA udgår og bliver fremover til Dansk Diabetes Database (DDD/DDiD), som gik i drift pr. 1/7 2022.

title: SDS
text:
Population
The DD2 data is uploaded to SDS, and they check the validity of the CPR-numbers before encrypting them. The data set DS_EXT_DD2_POP includes individuals with a valid CPR-number. Individuals with a non-valid CPR-number are still included in the uploaded data, e.g. in DS_EXT_DD2CORE, but they will have a missing encrypted CPR-number (CPR_ENCRYPTED) and can thus not be linked across data sources. Previously (when we had local data), we would notify DD2 (Odense) about non-valid CPR-numbers, but this is no longer possible as we are not allowed to identify the individuals based on individual-level data on the servers.

title: DD2 biobank data
text:
Gamle datasæt
N = 1053 er indlæst fra txt.
ProjektID - hvordan er den lavet?

Data vi har modtaget på KEA (gammelt setup):

First1053Patients, n=1053 med resultater fra blodprøver
UrinResultatermedRatio2013Nov, n=1052 med resultater fra urinprøver
DataTilDD2medFastende, n=5966 med resultater på GAD, glucose og cpeptid, samt en variabel med faste.
WrongCpeptidmeas, n=105 med cpeptid og ny cpeptid, men jeg har en note om en mail fra Jens om at disse ikke skal bruges til noget.
Data fra AG (MBL+GENO)


MBL: (Gedebjerg et al. 2020) C-pep. CRP: (Gedebjerg et al. 2023)
